description: Perhaps from Middle English flouten (“to play the flute”); compare with Dutch fluiten.

entries.meaning: The act by which something is flouted; violation of a law.
examples: A flout is when someone deliberately and ostentatiously contravenes a maxim.

verbs.description: flout (third-person singular simple present flouts, present participle flouting, simple past and past participle flouted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To express contempt for (laws, rules, etc.) by word or action.
examples: The manoeuvres of Microsoft and HP appear to comply with the letter of the regulations, even if they flout their spirit.
Three gaudy standards flout the pale blue sky.
